page.title: 01Central and West Cromer
page.content: Most of this block is sea but in the southwest Cromer stands on undulating ground between the cliffs and the ridge to he south. In central Cromer tightly packed cottages, hotels, houses, pubs and shops cluster around the church. Odd corners retain a quaint charm. Westwards a grid system of guest house apartments leads to more modern housing at the perimeter of development. Beyond, towards East Runton the clifftop fields sprout caravans and tents in summer. Back from t he coast around the railway the fields are used for grazing and crops, with scattered buildings and trees. Being a resort many are connected with tourist facilites. Cromer is also a commercial and administrative centre providing goodstand services for North Norfolk. The number ofretirees is probably
